definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
meal cooked in a large pot/communal meal/(fig.) system that rewards everyone equally regardless of merit
lit. to eat from the common pot (idiom)/fig. to be rewarded the same, regardless of performance

sentences.english: Even witches appreciate what they bring to a boiling cauldron.
sentences.chinese: 就连巫婆都喜欢沸腾着的冒着气泡的大锅。

sentences.english: Toss the pancetta into a large pot, preferably a big, heavy dutch oven.
sentences.chinese: 将咸肉碎放入一个大锅内，最好是大的重的荷兰烤盘。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, in a large saucepan, combine the sugar, cornstarch and salt.
sentences.chinese: 同时，在一个大锅中，混合白糖，玉米淀粉和盐。

sentences.english: She fit nicely on the over-sized pan.
sentences.chinese: 她的体形和这张超大锅刚好搭配。

sentences.english: That night, I cooked a big "pig-knuckle soup".
sentences.chinese: 晚上，我煮了一大锅蹄花汤。

sentences.english: People probably cooked their food in large pots, using twigs to remove it.
sentences.chinese: 从前人们使用大锅煮熟食物，并用树枝从中夹食。

sentences.english: Bring large pot of salted water to boil.
sentences.chinese: 把加有咸盐的水在一个大锅中煮沸。

sentences.english: Thus, it can avoid the phenomenon normally called enjoying "the mess".
sentences.chinese: 这样一来就消除了通常称作吃“大锅饭”的局面。

sentences.english: In a large pot, heat the olive oil over medium heat.
sentences.chinese: 用一个大锅，中火加热橄榄油。

sentences.english: This helps eradicate the practice of eating from the same big pot.
sentences.chinese: 这样一来就消除了通常称作吃“大锅饭”的局面。

sentences.english: For a very large pasta pot of water, I usually use two small handfuls of salt.
sentences.chinese: 如果煮一大锅意大利面的水，我一般用上两小把盐。

sentences.english: Only lazybones and mediocre persons could hanker after the days of messing together.
sentences.chinese: 只有懒汉庸才才会留恋那大锅饭的年代。

sentences.english: Boil for 2 or 3 minutes and then turn off the heat.
sentences.chinese: 放入一大锅热开水中煮2到3分钟，熄火。

sentences.english: But Guangdong is a caldron of manufacturing and urban growth.
sentences.chinese: 但广东是一口制造业和城市增长的沸腾大锅。

sentences.english: Bring a large pot of salted water to the boil and cook the spaghetti lunghi according to the packet.
sentences.chinese: 烧开一大锅盐水，放入意面按照包装要求煮好意面。

definition: see 鍋|锅[guo1]/see 涮鍋子|涮锅子[shuan4 guo1 zi5]/bowl (of a smoking pipe etc)
large kitchen stove made from bricks or earth/(PRC) ordinary mess hall (lowest dining standard, ranked below 中灶[zhong1 zao4] for mid-level cadres and 小灶[xiao3 zao4] for the most privileged)
to cook in a small quantity of water
